location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 31/6 (4/7 II) EDUCATION OF YOUNGER MEMBERS OF AL KHALIFAH'

physicalDescription.extent: File papers are arranged more or less chronologically from the front to the rear of the file. They are followed by file notes (folios 143-154).

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 157; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-140; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence concerning the education of the younger members of the Al Khalifah Ruling Family. Topics discussed include arrangements for judicial training in Palestine and the practicalities of starting a degree course at either Stanford University in the United States of America or the University of Bristol, United Kingdom. The file includes a list (folio 142) of the names of the sons of the Rulers of the Trucial Coast and Qatar.
